Descripción: Sobre CuéntameSomos una plataforma tecnológica que promueve la salud mental en empresas que priorizan el bienestar personal de sus colaboradores. Brindamos herramientas de alta calidad para tener una mejor autogestión emocional y apoyamos a que a través de datos agregados y anonimizados las organizaciones puedan tomar decisiones, para prevenir los riesgos psicosociales y promover seguridad psicológica. Cada solución que ofrecemos está pensada para apoyar a los colaboradores y sus familiares a autogestionar sus niveles de estrés, insomnio, autoestima y diferentes situaciones que van atravesando en su día a día.‎﻿Sobre Data EngineerEn este rol formarás parte de nuestro equipo de Tecnología y parte importante de todo el equipo Cuéntame. Serás responsable de dirigir el diseño arquitectónico, desarrollar planes de implementación, fomentar las mejores prácticas y planear pruebas de calidad para proyectos que involucren grandes volúmenes de datos. Construirás y darás mantenimiento a los pilares que soportan las tareas de análisis de datos, big data y machine learning en Cuéntame. Como parte del equipo de Tecnología deberás adoptar una cultura ágil enfocada en otorgar el mayor valor al usuario en el menor tiempo posible, asegurando la calidad de los entregables.Esperamos que seas un profesional experto en tecnología, que sienta curiosidad por las nuevas tecnologías digitales y aspire a combinar la usabilidad con el diseño visual. En última instancia, debes poder crear arquitectura de datos funcional y costo efectiva para Cuéntame, asegurando el fácil e inmediato acceso del equipo a la información.‎MisiónHabilitar a la organización para implementar una estrategia basada en datos a través del diseño, implementación y mantenimiento de una infraestructura robusta que permita la recolección, almacenamiento y el análisis de los datos a escala.‎ResponsabilidadesComo Data Engineer tendrás las siguientes responsabilidades dentro del equipo Cuéntame:Diseñar e implementar arquitecturas de datos altamente escalables y de alto rendimiento, que integren datos de diversas fuentes, administrando datos estructurados y no estructurados.Interactuar con otros equipos de tecnología para extraer, transformar y cargar datos de una amplia variedad de fuentes de datos.Preparar datos a través de la implementación de ETLs y Pipelines.Crear reportes utilizando tecnología para desarrollo de visualizaciones.Analizar, diagnosticar e identificar cuellos de botella en los flujos de datos.Supervisar y reportar constantemente sobre el rendimiento de los sistemas de gestión de datos.Dar mantenimiento y generar propuestas de mejora de las soluciones de datos implementadas.Automatizar pruebas unitarias a través de código.Escribir documentos y guías de requisitos funcionales.Mantenerse conectado con las tecnologías emergentes y las tendencias de la industria.Liderar los proyectos, según sea necesario.‎﻿Competenciasa. Hard skills+4 años de experiencia en ingeniería de datos a gran escala con énfasis en análisis e informes.+2 años de experiencia desarrollando en un ecosistema similar a Hadoop.Experiencia en la creación de soluciones de Data Lake escalables en la nube, en tiempo real y de alto rendimiento.Competencia en el diseño e implementación de procesos ETL (Extracción, Transformación, Carga), que manejan grandes volúmenes de datos (terabytes de datos que requieren procesamiento distribuido).Experiencia en el desarrollo de soluciones dentro de los servicios en la nube (AWS, GCP o Azure).Experiencia trabajando con SQL en escenarios avanzados que requieren una gran optimización.Experiencia con bases de datos NoSQL como Apache HBase, MongoDB o Cassandra.Experiencia en tecnologías de procesamiento de flujos de datos, incluidos Kafka, Spark Streaming, etc.Experiencia en generación de visualizaciones de información (Kibana, Tableu o Grafana).Fundamentos sólidos de ingeniería (buenas prácticas de codificación, buenas habilidades de diseño arquitectónico).Fuertes habilidades generales de programación.Sólida experiencia con Python.Experiencia con Spark.‎﻿b. Soft SkillsCapacidad para trabajar en equipos de alto desempeño.Agilidad y capacidad de priorización.Autonomía y búsqueda de logro constante.Autoaprendizaje y curiosidad infinita.Capacidad de análisis y enfoque al detalle.Crítica constante enfocada a la mejora.Interés en aportar en la creación de ambientes laborales más seguros y conscientes de la importancia del bienestar de las personas.‎Sobre la VacanteOfrecemos una vacante de tiempo completo con oportunidad de desarrollo, flexibilidad de horarios y un excelente ambiente de trabajo.﻿Modalidad 100% RemotoCompensación mensual: 35,000 MXN - 38,000 ﻿MXN‎BeneficiosBono anual por desempeño.Acceso a plan de salud mental con plataforma personalizada para ti y 3 familiares sin costo.Atención emocional para ti con 8 sesiones de terapia psicológica sin costo.Atención emocional para 1 familiar con 8 sesiones de terapia psicológica sin costo.Modelo de trabajo 100% remoto.14 días de vacaciones en tu primer año las cuales puedes hacer uso a partir del 6to mes (7 días a elegir, 5 días la última semana de diciembre en la que se desconecta todo el equipo Cuéntame y 2 Mental Health Days al año, porque nos interesa tu salud mental y tu bienestar, para que descanses).Tipo de puesto: Tiempo completoSalario: $45,000.00 - $55,000.00 al mesHorario:Turno de 8 horasPrestaciones:Horarios flexiblesTrabajar desde casaVacaciones adicionales o permisos con goce de sueldoTipos de compensaciones:Bono anualConsideraciones ante el COVID-19:Trabajo RemotoExperiencia:Ingeniería de Datos: 4 años (Obligatorio)Creación de soluciones de Data Lake: 1 año (Deseable)Implementación de Procesos ETL: 1 año (Deseable)Idioma:Inglés (Deseable)
Estudios previos: not specified

Descripción: Corning is one of the world’s leading innovators in materials science. For more than 160 years, Corning has applied its unparalleled expertise in specialty glass, ceramics, and optical physics to develop products that have created new industries and transformed people’s lives.Corning succeeds through sustained investment in R&D, a unique combination of material and process innovation, and close collaboration with customers to solve tough technology challenges.Our Optical Communications segment has recently evolved from being a manufacturer of optical fiber and cable, hardware and equipment to being a comprehensive provider of industry-leading optical solutions across the broader communications industry.This segment is classified into two main product groupings – carrier network and enterprise network. The carrier network product group consists primarily of products and solutions for optical-based communications infrastructure for services such as video, data and voice communications. The enterprise network product group consists primarily of optical-based communication networks sold to businesses, governments and individuals for their own use.Position Description: Serve as a process data transfer engineer for Automation and Molding Operations and any assigned extension within Divisional Engineering. Advance the state of Manufacturing 4.0 across the Automation and Molding organization through the expansion and usage data analytics tools. The candidate will act as the process lead for the overall Data Analytics and Controls team, with Automation and Molding as the primary discipline supported. He or she will become the Department SME regarding the structure and application of data analytics using the Kairos platform, as well as the tools used to retrieve, report and analyze data, with the primary objective to secure the usage of data as the main driver for continuous improvement activities.Responsibilities: Drive data analytics for assigned AreasDrive strategical and tactical plans for data analytics and controls for assigned AreasServe as data analytics SME using data collection, data analysis, and machine learning toolsBuild and deploy data-based models for use in process operational improvementLeverage knowledge from company resources through direct support and communities of practice and collaborationsProvide guidance to other process engineers regarding data analytics best practicesProvide guidance to controls engineers regarding data analytics needs to link with hardwareProvide process direction and recommendations for data analytics and controls innovationsIdentify areas of opportunity for data reporting, analysis, and machine learning model buildingReview results and provide interpretation to ensure validityRecommend additional data for collection, and linkages between data setsLeverage corporate data analytics teams to impact assigned area, Plant, as neededUtilize, Review and Create queries, dashboards, and graphical visualizations to access and report dataCoordinate with data science team on existing dashboards / graphical visualizations and create new onesBecome proficient in using no code / low code solutions to access data through the Databricks environmentLead process improvement activitiesLeverage data to determine improvement and paths for actionDesign and execute experiments to enable data-based decisionsImplement solutions to improve cost, culture, capability and capacityTravel Requirements: up to 15%Required Education: Bachelor of Science in Engineering or equivalentInstrumentation and Controls background will be a plus+5 years’ experience in plant engineering or an engineering support role to a manufacturing operation.+3 years’ experience in a manufacturing operation under data science related role.Required Skills: Programming experience with python, R, or similar data analysis languageBackground in statistics and machine learningBackground in hand-on controls engineering (Problem solving)Data Based Decision Making Skills with emphasis on data analysis, data visualization, and communicationStrong Problem-Solving SkillsBilingual (English/Spanish), Proficiency English skillsFamiliar with manufacturing statistical application tools (DOE, MSA, SPC, DMAIC, etc).Working knowledge of programming in Python. Data Analysis knowledge using any mix of software including, but not limited to: JMP, MATLAB, R, Minitab, SAS, C++, Java.Experience in work with complex databases (such as SQL server, PI (AF), etc).Experience in building and maintaining BI dashboards (such as PowerBI, tableau, Dash, etc).Desired Skills: Master’s degree preferredGreen Belt Certification or 6-Sigma EquivalentProject leadership skills, including multi-cultural teamsExpertise in change management and documentation control systemsUnderstanding of Process Control and Process Discipline toolsStatistical tools such as statistical process control, hypothesis testing, sampling plans, capability analysisExperimental design and analysisTraining in KT and MEEFamiliarity with Lean Manufacturing practicesAbility to engage with shop floor personnel and with plant leadershipAble to communicate through remote means (conference calls, email, IM)Professional written and spoken communicationTipo de puesto: Tiempo completoSalario: $35,000.00 - $40,000.00 al mesIdioma:Inglés (Obligatorio)
Estudios previos: bachelor of science in engineering or equivalent

Descripción: Nuestros procesos de Atracción de Talento cumplen con el protocolo de sanidad vigente.Vinte es una Inmobiliaria Mexicana con más de 18 años de operación en el sector y comprometida con la generación de valor para sus clientes, colaboradores y accionistas. Contamos con el Distintivo Empresa Socialmente Responsable 2021.La operación de Vinte comprende toda la cadena de valor del negocio de vivienda, incluyendo la adquisición de los terrenos, urbanización, diseño, construcción, equipamiento y comercialización de viviendas, así como la promoción de vida en comunidad. ¡Suma tu talento a una de las Super Empresas Top Companies 2021!En Vinte vivirás una experiencia profesional y personal única:Innovación: Estamos abiertos a propuestas creativas y que desafíen lo convencional, el cambio es parte de nuestra cultura y buscamos adaptarnos de manera ágil en beneficio de clientes, colaboradores y asociados.Pertenencia: Gran parte de tu trabajo será en compañía de otros colaboradores para potenciar tu resultado individual.Pasión: Te daremos experiencias profesionales que te reten y te hagan crecer, que te impulsen a ser mejor y se conviertan en el sentido de vida profesional que buscasTrascendencia: Tendrás la oportunidad de proponer y de ser escuchado, tendrás acompañamiento de expertos para soportar tus propuestas; al momento de crecer profesionalmente harás crecer a Vinte.Únete al equipo Vinte como:  DATA SCIENTIST Objetivo del puesto: Este puesto contribuye al posicionamiento exitoso de Vinte apoyándonos con tecnología que nos ayude a incrementar la velocidad de la toma de decisiones basadas en predicciones automáticas oportunas.RESPONSABILIDADES DEL PUESTO: · Desarrollar algoritmos de exploración, análisis y procesamiento de datos, estadísticos y de machine learning, con múltiples orígenes y formatos.· Crear y escalar modelos de machine learning que impacten directamente al incremento de ventas y en la predicción de patrones que ayuden a incrementar la rentabilidad de la compañía· Crear proyectos analíticos desde su inicio, empezando con la exploración de datos hasta la generación de funciones, la construcción de modelos, gestionar su implementación y monitoreo.· Buscar oportunidades para utilizar los conocimientos, conjuntos de datos, código y modelos en otras funciones de la organización, con espíritu curioso de aplicar algoritmos para resolver problemas.· Evaluar de manera regular el uso y el funcionamiento adecuado de los modelos, y ser responsable del control de versiones y optimización de los modelos.· Diseñar, analizar e interpretar los resultados de experimentos estadísticos.· Impulsar la recopilación de nuevos datos para los modelos y el perfeccionamiento de las fuentes de datos existentes.· Aportar experiencia al equipo para ayudar a diseñar y priorizar proyectos en las diversas áreas donde se deban crear proyectos de machine learning.REQUISITOS: · Escolaridad: Licenciatura Ciencias de la Computación, Ciencia de Datos o Disciplina Cuántica, Estadísticas, Matemáticas Aplicadas· Experiencia 4 años en puesto afín.· Competencias del puesto: Análisis, Orientación a resultado, habilidades de manejo de datos, comunicación, toma de decisiones, solución de problemas.OFRECEMOS: · Sueldo competitivo + Atractivo paquete de prestaciones· Oportunidades de desarrollo profesional· Estabilidad laboralZona de Trabajo: Santa FeSi consideras que cuentas con todo lo necesario para postularte, aplica ahora.En Vinte podrás vivir una experiencia profesional excepcional, donde podrás desarrollar tu potencial, y a la vez contribuir a que nuestras comunidades tengan una vida como debería ser la vida.Tipo de puesto: Tiempo completoSalario: A partir de $40,000.00 al mesHorario:DiurnoPrestaciones:Vales de despensaConsideraciones ante el COVID-19:Cuidamos el protocola sanitario, uso de cubrebocas en todo momento, sanitización al ingreso a oficinas, sana distancia.
Estudios previos: licenciatura ciencias de la computación, ciencia de datos o disciplina cuántica, estadísticas, matemáticas aplicadas
Habilidades blandas: comunicación, toma de decisiones, solución de problemas

Descripción: Empresa Financiera solicita: Director de Ciencia de DatosOBJETIVOGestionar el equipo de ciencia de datos, planear proyectos y crear modelos analíticos. Descripción:
Esta vacante viene de la bolsa de empleo Talenteca.com
Integra Soluciones es una Empresa con 17 años en el mercado y presencia nacional dedicada a la gestión de créditos fortaleciendo a la operación de las instituciones financieras más importantes del país. Estamos comprometidos con el medio ambiente y somos una empresa socialmente responsable.
Creemos que cada colaborador es pieza fundamental para el logro de los resultados, por lo cual fomentamos el desarrollo de nuestra gente y también invitamos nuevos talentos a incorporarse a la familia. Por expansión buscamos unAnalista de Datosy esta oportunidad es para ti.
Requisitos:
Licenciatura afín
Experiencia 1 año en Creación de KPI´S, elaboración de dashboard en Power BI o Excel, implementación de algoritmos, extracción de información de bases de datos mediante consultas en SQL.
Manejo de programas: SQL y Power BI programas sugeridos no indispensables, Excel manejo de tablas dinámicas (avanzado indispensable).
Comunicación, proactividad, trabajo en equipo, enfoque al detalle, analítico, responsable.
FUNCIONES:
Documentación de procedimientos y actividades
Seguimiento a solicitudes por parte del área operativa
Capacidad de análisis con conocimiento para realizar mejoras tanto en configuraciones, performances relacionados a motores de bases de datos, todos sus objetos, conexiones y consultas.
BENEFICIOS:
Prestaciones de ley, prestaciones superiores a la ley
Capacitación y crecimiento real y garantizado dentro de la empresa a corto plazo.
Sueldo $10,447 mesuales + bono mensual.
Vales de despensa mensuales.
Esquema Híbrido.
Cuauhtémoc, Ciudad de México.
Interesados que cumplan con los requisitos portularse por este medio.
¡Te estamos esperando!

Descripción: Como gerente de analistas de datos para nuestros equipos de crecimiento, ayudará a construir las bases de datos y brindará los conocimientos que necesitamos para crecer rápidamente. Tendrá un papel clave para garantizar que estemos utilizando nuestros datos de la mejor manera posible, asegurando decisiones más informadas y permitiendo que sus colegas desarrollen las habilidades necesarias para enfrentar los desafíos que se avecinan.Qué harás como Data Analyst ManagerAsuma un papel de analista principal en nuestros equipos de crecimientoTrabaje como analista de datos y cree las condiciones para un gran conocimiento y desarrolloEleve el nivel en la disciplina de analista de datosAtraer, reclutar e incorporar analistas de datosDesarrollo estrategico de analista de datos para areas de Usear research, UX, Marketing, Ventas, TILo siguiente probablemente será útil Experiencia como gerente de analista de datos (o un puesto de liderazgo similar) en una empresa moderna de productos y tecnología.Experiencia trabajando en un entorno de crecimiento o creando productos de crecimiento.Se prefiere una maestría o superior en un campo técnico y/o cuantitativo, como informática, matemáticas, física o economía.Historial comprobado de atraer y reclutar analistas de datos.Con experiencia en la organización de analistas de datos de la mejor manera posible en diversos entornos.Capacidad comprobada para entregar productos y soluciones que resuelvan las necesidades reales de los clientes con un modelo de negocio viable.Experiencia en proyectos líderes que construyen soluciones digitales a escala; lo más delgado y ágil posible.*Más de 2 años de experiencia realizando análisis cuantitativos de productos/negociosAltamente competente con SQL y herramientas de visualización (p. ej., Tableau) y al menos un lenguaje de secuencias de comandos/estadístico (se prefiere R, Python)Asóciese con equipos multifuncionales para definir métricas de éxito, cree enfoques para rastrear los datos y solucionar errores, cuantifique y evalúe los datos, luego desarrolle un lenguaje común para que todos los colegas entiendan estos KPI.Buenas habilidades comunicativas, tanto escritas como orales. Puede establecer relaciones causales y conocimientos significativos utilizando metodologías y datos estadísticos.Experiencia práctica con la experimentación, incluido el diseño, la implementación y las metodologías (p. ej., prueba de hipótesis y análisis de regresión) para analizar e interpretar los resultados para los socios.Experiencia en la consulta y manipulación de conjuntos de datos sin procesar para su análisisCómodo funcionamiento en espacios con alta ambigüedad y adaptarse fácilmente a entornos cambiantesAquí hay algunas maneras en las que tendrá un impacto: Definir y monitorear regularmente indicadores clave de rendimiento, métricas de éxito y resaltar ideas para optimizar nuestra experiencia de usuario en todas las plataformas.Configure y evalúe los resultados de las pruebas A/B e impulse los próximos pasos a un ritmo aceleradoEntregue informes e información estratégica a través de análisis y extracciones manuales de datos de varias plataformas publicitarias, herramientas de datos y seguimiento interno para impulsar los OKR.Dimensionar la oportunidad de diferentes estrategias e iniciativas de productosComunicar de manera óptima los hallazgos a los miembros internos y externos del equipo.Liderar la investigación, el desarrollo y la entrega de modelos analíticos que se utilizarán para diseñar estrategias y probar nuevas mejoras y funciones de productos.Tipo de puesto: Medio tiempoHoras de medio tiempo: 20 por semanaSalario: $5,886.00 - $19,050.00 al mesHorario:Horario flexibleLunes a viernesPrestaciones:Aumentos salarialesHorarios flexiblesPrograma de referidosTrabajar desde casaTipos de compensaciones:Bono anualEducación:Licenciatura terminada (Obligatorio)Experiencia:Analista de marketing: 4 años (Obligatorio)SQL: 1 año (Deseable)Análisis de datos: 1 año (Deseable)Google Analytics: 4 años (Obligatorio)Google Analytics 360: 4 años (Obligatorio)Licencia/Certificación:Google Analytics Certification (Obligatorio)Fecha de inicio prevista: 15/06/2022

Descripción: The Sr. Data Analyst is responsible for interpreting data and converting it into information, which can offer ways to improve the business, thus affecting business decisions. The Data Analyst will gather information from various sources and interpret patterns and trends. Once data has been gathered and interpreted, the Data Analyst will report back what has been found in a comprehensive study/report.Responsibilities: 1. Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.2. Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.3. Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.4. Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.5. Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $26,000.00 per month

Empresa: INERCOM ASESORIA INDUSTRIAL S.A DE C.V
Descripción: Buscamos un Analista Financiero con experiencia para pronosticar ingresos y gastos y asesoramiento sobre futuros presupuestos. Para este puesto debe de tener el candidato un titulo en Finanzas o Contabilidad, con experiencia laboral relevante y constatada. El conocimiento de los modelos de pronóstico y los procesos de Contabilidad de costos son requisitos claves para el puesto. Explorará opciones de inversión y establecerá políticas financieras para toda la empresa.Actividades:Desarrollar modelos financieros mediante evaluaciones comparativas y análisis de procesos. Preparar proyectos de costos. Analizar e informar sobre el estado financiero actual, Llevar a cabo una investigación exhaustiva de los datos financieros históricos. Explorar las opciones de inversión y presente riesgos y oportunidades. Coordinar con Gerencia de Finanzas sobre la planificación financiera a largo plazo. Comparar los resultados previstos y reales e identificar áreas de mejora. Participar en la elaboración de de presupuestos por departamentos. Establecer políticas financieras. Mantener la confidencialidad de la información.REQUISITOSExperiencia laboral comprobable como Analista Financiero, experiencia práctica con software financiero y estadístico. INDISPENSABLE Sepa manejar Excel Avanzado al 100% Tablas dinámicas y Macros. Comprensión de los sistemas de planificación de recursos financieros (ERP). Capacidad para presentar datos financieros mediante informes y gráficos detallados. Habilidad demostrable de pensamiento estratégico. Licenciatura en Finanzas, Contabilidad o Economía.INDISPENSABLE Viva en Tlajomulco o sus alrededores si la persona tienen vehículo y el traslado en carro a la ubicación de la planta es mas de 1: 15 min hora nos reservamos la decisión de Contratación. El puesto es UrgenteTipo de puesto: Tiempo completoSalario: $27,000.00 - $30,000.00 al mesHorario:Turno de 10 horasPrestaciones:Aumentos salarialesEstacionamiento gratuitoOpción a contrato indefinidoServicio de comedor con descuentoVales de despensaConsideraciones ante el COVID-19:Si llevamos todos los procedimientos establecidos por la STPS

Backed by TPG Rise, TPG’s global impact investing platform,Anew is accelerating the fight against climate change by enabling any company or organization to align its goals for conservation and impact with actionable next steps. Anew has offices in the U.S., Canada, and Europe, and an environmental commodities portfolio that extends across five continents. We’re seeking high-energy, creative, value-driven team players eager to apply their talents to the defining challenge of our time. Descripción: About usSurgical Safety Technologies Inc. (SST) is a fast-growing healthcare technology start-up located in the heart of Toronto, Canada. SST’s OR Black Box® is a platform that captures some of the world’s most valuable data from surgery and allows hospitals to identify, understand, and mitigate risk. The OR Black Box® is implemented in several of the most prestigious hospitals in North America and Europe and was named one of Time Magazine’s Best Inventions of 2019. We are a dynamic and mission-driven organization that aims to improve quality of healthcare and save lives of surgical patients around the world. If you share the same values, we encourage you to connect with us.A Medical Data Analyst I annotates surgical videos using specialized software to identify key events in the operating room. This requires exceptional attention to detail, critical thinking, an aptitude for technology, and the ability to quickly learn how an operating room functions.Duties and responsibilitiesA Medical Data Analyst I works under the direction of the Medical Data Analyst I Team Lead to analyze, annotate, and perform quality assurance on data and analytics generated by the OR Black Box® platform. Specific tasks include labelling for training of artificial intelligence models, analysis of key milestones and events, and evaluation of standard operating procedures.o Annotating video and audio files according to established frameworks and reference documents by using specialized software.o Contributing to the development of reference documents related to the tasks.o Participating in continuous education activities.o Providing feedback to internal stakeholders regarding the use of our software platforms.o Completing assigned tasks within required timeframes.o Maintaining performance standards for credentialed tasksSkills and Knowledgeo Bachelor’s Degree preferred, High School Diploma requiredo Experience or interest in health sciences preferredo Exceptional attention to detailo Ability to work with cross-functional teamso Proficient knowledge of computer systems and technologieso Passion for data efficiency and accuracyo Excellent written and verbal communication skillso Ability to meet deadlinesWorking conditionsThe work of the Medical Data Analyst I is performed in an office environment.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: $40,000.00-$45,000.00 per yearBenefits:Casual dressDental careExtended health careStock optionsVision careFlexible Language Requirement:French not requiredSchedule:8 hour shiftDay shiftMonday to FridayAbility to commute/relocate:Toronto, ON M5H 3R3: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)Application question(s):This job requires the employee to stare at computer screens for long periods of time. Job Summary
Junior Data and Reporting Analyst - Amendment (September 15th, 2022): Posting closing date extended to (September 22nd, 2022)
Research Officer R18
This position can be based in any Attorney General office. The locations listed above are to assist applicants in searching for this opportunity and are not a fulsome list of locations.
We offer flexible work arrangements, including the opportunity to volunteer to telework (with conditions) as set out in applicable employer policies.
An eligibility list may be established to fill future temporary and permanent vacancies.
On November 1, 2021 the BC Public Service announced the COVID-19 Vaccination Policy that defines the conditions and expectations for BC Public Service employees regarding vaccination against COVID-19. Among other possible measures, proof of vaccination will be required. It is a term of acceptance of employment that you agree to comply with all vaccination requirements that apply to the public service. More information can be found here.
Apply your expertise in research and analysis to support exceptional service delivery
The BC Prosecution Service (BCPS) contributes to the protection of society by preparing for and conducting prosecutions diligently and fairly, and by striving to develop the most effective methods to administer justice in the Province. The Assistant Deputy Attorney General (ADAG) is responsible for the administration of the BCPS, which is divided into Headquarters, Criminal Appeals and Special Prosecutions (CASP) and five regions, each led by a Regional Crown Counsel. The BCPS prosecutes offences under the Criminal Code of Canada, the Youth Criminal Justice Act and Provincial Statutes in the Provincial, Supreme and Appeal Courts of British Columbia and in the Supreme Court of Canada. The BCPS also provides legal advice to government and police on criminal law matters and develops policies and procedures on issues relating to the prosecution of criminal offences.
As a member of the analytics team within the Strategic Information & Business Application unit of BC Prosecution Service Headquarter, the Junior Data Reporting Analyst provides data expertise to support the development and maintenance of business intelligence (BI) reports on the new PowerBI platform. This position will also provide procedural support and training in all aspects of the PowerBI application for users across the BC Prosecution Service (BCPS), including assisting BCPS users in the transition from the Tableau BI platform to PowerBI. The analyst will respond to information needs by developing and using quantitative and qualitative analysis techniques to determine trends, patterns and to generate insight for business areas making evidence-based decisions.
We are seeking someone who has good knowledge of relational databases and experience working with business intelligence software that turns data into meaningful information for users. This role requires sound judgement and excellent organizational abilities. If you are a motivated, results oriented professional looking to gain valuable experience in a fast-paced, collaborative team environment, we look forward to your application.
BC Prosecution Service has a hybrid work model where staff are supported to work part of their time in the office and part of their time from home, when operationally feasible. We believe that flexibility in where we work supports our culture of community and work-life balance, while maintaining productivity, engagement and collaboration.
The BC Public Service is committed to creating a diverse workplace to represent the population we serve and to better meet the needs of our citizens. Consider joining our team and being part of an innovative, inclusive and rewarding workplace.
The Indigenous Applicant Advisory Service is available to applicants that self-identify as Indigenous (First Nations, status or non-status, Métis, or Inuit) seeking work or already employed in the BC Public Service. For advice and guidance on applying and/or preparing for an interview for this opportunity, we invite applicants to connect with the Indigenous Applicant Advisor Amanda by email: IndigenousApplicants@gov.bc.ca or by phone: 778-698-1336.
For complete details about this opportunity, including accountabilities, please refer to the attached job profile. For specific position related enquiries, please contact Cathy.Wolseylee@gov.bc.ca. DO NOT SEND YOUR APPLICATION TO THIS EMAIL ADDRESS. For more information about how to complete your job application, add/edit your resume and for more useful tips when applying for jobs, please refer to the Your Job Application page on the MyHR website. If you are still experiencing technical difficulty applying for a competition, please send an e-mail to BCPSA.Hiring.Centre@gov.bc.ca, before the stated closing time, and we will respond as soon as possible to assist you.

NOTE: Applications will be accepted until 11:00 pm Pacific Standard Time on the closing date of the competition.

Job Requirements:
In order to be considered for this position, your application must clearly demonstrate how you meet the education and experience as outlined below:
Post-secondary diploma and 1 year **related experience; or degree and 6 months **related experience; or certificate and 2 years **related experience obtained from a recognized institution for a *related field of education
Equivalent combination of education plus training and experience in a **related field may be considered.
Related Education may include the following:
Data science,
Computer science,
GIS,
Statistics,
Mathematics, or
relevant specialty degrees as designated by program requirements

**Related Experience must include all of the following:
Experience with reporting/data mining tools (e.g., Power BI and Tableau).
Experience in data collection and use of relational databases and data management.
Experience querying databases with common data querying tools, such as SQL Server

Preference may be given to applicants with any of the following:
Experience delivering technical projects in support of client’s business needs.
Experience providing direct client service including prioritizing, troubleshooting and resolving client data and reporting issues, as a primary point of contact.
Experience developing dashboards and reports in Power BI.
Experience developing reports and presentations for management and executive level audiences.
Management Studio (SSMS), Oracle SQL Developer, R, Python.

Applicants selected to move forward in the hiring process may be assessed on the Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Competencies as outlined in the attached Job Profile located in the Additional Information section at the bottom of the posting.
Enhanced Security Screening will be required.

Ensure your resume includes your educational accomplishments, employment history including start and end dates (month and year) of your employment, and any relevant information that relates to the job to which you are applying.

IMPORTANT: Comprehensive questionnaire responses will be used to shortlist applicants against the job requirements. Please ensure you include all relevant information about your educational accomplishments and employment history including job titles, start and end dates (month and year) of your employment, and your accountabilities and accomplishments.

Descripción:
JOB PURPOSE:
Working closely with the Food Security Team, the Junior Business Analyst – Food Security, is responsible for data stewardship, reporting, analytics and back-end integration of the United Way BC Food Security Data Hub. The position is responsible for developing and preparing effective reporting tools, conducting analysis, developing models and corresponding strategic goals and Key Performance Indicators (KPI’s). This position is responsible for leading and/or participating in organizational initiatives related to research, reporting and analytics as well as identifying trends and informing strategy.
This is a Temporary Full-Time position, and currently budgeted until September 2023.
DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:
Data Coordination
Maintains standardized accountability and reporting systems for the Data Hub
Verifies the quality and integrity of data and information collected via the Data Hub
Supports and manages dashboards for monitoring key metrics including community impact
Creates and maintains manuals, guidelines and departmental protocols
Supports program sites to meet the data and reporting requirements

Reporting and Analytics
Generates accurate and effective reports through narratives, statistical information, and graphic/visual descriptors of data
Conducts comprehensive analysis; highlighting key insights and recommendations to inform UWBC’s Food Security strategy
Identifies trends and patterns through the synthesis of program data
Produces local community-level and province-wide dashboards through data mining operations
Leads and/or participates in organizational initiatives related to research, reporting and analytics

Strategic Planning and Goal Setting

Attention to detail; excellent organizational and time management skills

Some hours outside of business hours to attend meetings and events

For success at UWBC and in this role, certain demonstrable characteristics will be required:
A commitment to building healthy, caring and inclusive communities, internally and externally
Embodying the organization's core values to be collaborative, compassionate, strategic, responsive, accountable, and inspiring
Ability to navigate ambiguity and comfortably operate in it
Drive to succeed as an individual and as a team member
At UWBC, we don’t just accept difference – we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, programs, donors, and the communities we live and work in. Posting Closes
September 2, 2022 @ 3:00pm (MST)

Full Time Permanent

Additional Information
Servus is growing! We are looking for an intermediate Infrastructure Analyst in our Information Services department.
This role will support our technical infrastructure and application systems. They will be required to act with a minimum of supervision while adhering to defined Information Services (IS) policies, procedures, and best practices. At all times provide timely responses to ticketed work, managing requestor expectations, adhering to service level targets, ensuring customer satisfaction and aligning with corporate directions as defined by management.
A primary goal of this position is to support the production environment ensuring Core Infrastructure Services availability. This position works closely with not only other Infrastructure Centre of Expertise (COE) members but also the Platform & Customer Service COE.
This intermediate position will be required to provide problem resolution, foster growth, manage projects, will have high standards and values, is a source of leadership and guidance, has strong work ethics, and mentors other Infrastructure COE members.
More specifically, the scope of your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:
Designing, implementing and maintaining of many primary business process and technical areas. Including, datacenter infrastructure, remote branch hardware, file services, site reliability and high availability management.
Supporting the deployment, monitoring, maintenance, development, upgrade, and administration of infrastructure technologies including physical servers and storage infrastructure, and virtualization infrastructure technology.
Monitoring and test network performance and provide statistics and reports.
Ensuring that the Infrastructure service standards, procedures, and policies are strictly adhered to including but not limited to software and hardware installation, new server builds, infrastructure design and security controls.
Providing monitoring of infrastructure systems and applications including but not limited to Nutanix Infrastructure, Insight Manager, and the DMZ network.
Performing continuous improvements to infrastructure through monitoring, reporting, analyzing, and enhancing.
Ensuring operation and high availability of the Virtual Server Infrastructure through monitoring of datastores, virtual guests, maintaining network port groups and implementing accepted solutions.
Ensuring availability and continuity of systems through fault tolerance, High Availability and Distributed Resource Scheduler.
Supporting the Network team as needed to maintain security boundaries between production banking, DMZ, development and test environments.
Maintaining up to date knowledge of industry changes and direction through research, literature, seminars and knowledge sharing.
Developing and maintain process automation using the tools available.
Monitoring systems for adherence to corporate security policies.
Maintaining current knowledge of Servus’ Infrastructure and evolving changes within the environment by sharing information to keep current on new products, services, hardware or other configuration changes within the Infrastructure.
Serve as an escalation point for junior staff and other teams.
Maintain awareness of current products, services, protocols, and standards in support of all infrastructure procurement and development efforts.
Requirements
To qualify, you will need at least the following:
Having a solid understanding of the architecture, design, implementation and management of all aspects of Nutanix HCI.
Grade twelve education and a minimum undergraduate degree or technical college diploma in Computer Science, Mathematics or Engineering and 6 or more years’ technical Information Services related experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Minimum of 4 years of demonstrated infrastructure engineering and support experience ideally in a service-based industry.
Must have a minimum of one (1) recent network or telecom technical certification [Cisco preferred], with two (2) recent technical certifications highly desirable, certification and a strong background working with hardware and network components.
At least 7 years of proven experience working with Information Technology in a corporate multi-platform, multi-vendor environment.
Knowledgeable of Windows and Linux Operating Systems (OS).
Having a solid understanding of the architecture, design, implementation and management of all aspects of a Virtual Infrastructure.
HP 3PAR SAN Management and Administration.
Familiarity with the fundamentals of IS security, and security hardening practices.
Knowledge of networking, hardware, software, desktop, Microsoft Office, and excellent knowledge of information systems and security.
Must have experience in an enterprise telecommunications organization.
Must have experience managing a multi-vendor VoIP system and a blended PRI and SIP telephone service.
Must have experience in F5 Big-IP design and implementation (LTM & ASM).
Must have experience in inter-VRF routing and troubleshooting.
Must have experience with legacy firewalls, application firewalls, IDS and IPS.
Must have experience with VPN to secure WAN traffic and remote workers.
Must demonstrate knowledge of packet-level troubleshooting techniques (Wireshark, IOS debug, etc.).
Must demonstrate experience troubleshooting WAN and LAN topologies.
Must demonstrate knowledge of network security infrastructure and operations.
Must have experience designing, implementing and operating datacenter networks and virtual computing systems.
Financial sector experience is considered an asset.
Experience with IT Operations Management tools an asset.
Familiarity with HP products including Data Protector and Remote Copy an asset.
Although not required, the following skills/experience/licenses/certificates are considered an asset:
Most importantly, we are looking for candidates with demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills. If you are a seasoned Infrastructure Tier 3 support resource capable of solving critical issues and an expert in a range of infrastructure technologies. looking for long-term career growth, then we encourage you to apply!
Benefits
Where we work?
Servus has introduced a new flexible hybrid work model which consists of a combination of working in the office and working remotely. The hybrid approach provides employees with more flexibility, while still allowing employees to connect in person and remotely and building upon the culture that makes Servus such a great place to work.
Why choose Servus?
Working for Servus has outstanding benefits. We offer our employees flexible and practical benefits in addition to competitive salaries and career building opportunities. Some of our benefits include:
Immediate financial service benefits
Group RSP programs available after 3 months
3-week vacation and vacation purchase program
Flexible group benefit plan
Flexible health and/or wellness spending account
Employee/family assistance program
Profit Share
Servus is building a culture where diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging are at the center of why we work and how we work. If you want to join a team of community leaders passionate in making an impact, apply now!
What happens next?
Thank you for applying with Servus Credit Union! If you are shortlisted for this opportunity, you will hear from us after the posting closes regarding next steps. Should you require an accommodation during the application and selection process, please contact us at careers@servus.ca with the position and location you are interested in.

Job Summary

Research Officer R18
This position can be based in any Attorney General office. The locations listed above are to assist applicants in searching for this opportunity and are not a fulsome list of locations.
We offer flexible work arrangements, including the opportunity to volunteer to telework (with conditions) as set out in applicable employer policies.
An eligibility list may be established to fill future temporary and permanent vacancies.
On November 1, 2021 the BC Public Service announced the COVID-19 Vaccination Policy that defines the conditions and expectations for BC Public Service employees regarding vaccination against COVID-19. Among other possible measures, proof of vaccination will be required. It is a term of acceptance of employment that you agree to comply with all vaccination requirements that apply to the public service. More information can be found here.
Apply your expertise in research and analysis to support exceptional service delivery
The BC Prosecution Service (BCPS) contributes to the protection of society by preparing for and conducting prosecutions diligently and fairly, and by striving to develop the most effective methods to administer justice in the Province. The Assistant Deputy Attorney General (ADAG) is responsible for the administration of the BCPS, which is divided into Headquarters, Criminal Appeals and Special Prosecutions (CASP) and five regions, each led by a Regional Crown Counsel. The BCPS prosecutes offences under the Criminal Code of Canada, the Youth Criminal Justice Act and Provincial Statutes in the Provincial, Supreme and Appeal Courts of British Columbia and in the Supreme Court of Canada. The BCPS also provides legal advice to government and police on criminal law matters and develops policies and procedures on issues relating to the prosecution of criminal offences.
As a member of the analytics team within the Strategic Information & Business Application unit of BC Prosecution Service Headquarter, the Junior Data Reporting Analyst provides data expertise to support the development and maintenance of business intelligence (BI) reports on the new PowerBI platform. This position will also provide procedural support and training in all aspects of the PowerBI application for users across the BC Prosecution Service (BCPS), including assisting BCPS users in the transition from the Tableau BI platform to PowerBI. The analyst will respond to information needs by developing and using quantitative and qualitative analysis techniques to determine trends, patterns and to generate insight for business areas making evidence-based decisions.
We are seeking someone who has good knowledge of relational databases and experience working with business intelligence software that turns data into meaningful information for users. This role requires sound judgement and excellent organizational abilities. If you are a motivated, results oriented professional looking to gain valuable experience in a fast-paced, collaborative team environment, we look forward to your application.
BC Prosecution Service has a hybrid work model where staff are supported to work part of their time in the office and part of their time from home, when operationally feasible. We believe that flexibility in where we work supports our culture of community and work-life balance, while maintaining productivity, engagement and collaboration.
The BC Public Service is committed to creating a diverse workplace to represent the population we serve and to better meet the needs of our citizens. Consider joining our team and being part of an innovative, inclusive and rewarding workplace.
The Indigenous Applicant Advisory Service is available to applicants that self-identify as Indigenous (First Nations, status or non-status, Métis, or Inuit) seeking work or already employed in the BC Public Service. For advice and guidance on applying and/or preparing for an interview for this opportunity, we invite applicants to connect with the Indigenous Applicant Advisor Amanda by email: IndigenousApplicants@gov.bc.ca or by phone: 778-698-1336.
For complete details about this opportunity, including accountabilities, please refer to the attached job profile. For specific position related enquiries, please contact Cathy.Wolseylee@gov.bc.ca. DO NOT SEND YOUR APPLICATION TO THIS EMAIL ADDRESS. For more information about how to complete your job application, add/edit your resume and for more useful tips when applying for jobs, please refer to the Your Job Application page on the MyHR website. If you are still experiencing technical difficulty applying for a competition, please send an e-mail to BCPSA.Hiring.Centre@gov.bc.ca, before the stated closing time, and we will respond as soon as possible to assist you.

NOTE: Applications will be accepted until 11:00 pm Pacific Standard Time on the closing date of the competition.

Preference may be given to applicants with any of the following:

Experience developing dashboards and reports in Power BI.
Experience developing reports and presentations for management and executive level audiences.
Management Studio (SSMS), Oracle SQL Developer, R, Python.

Descripción:
At Parallel Domain, we believe that autonomous systems – from self-driving cars to contactless delivery drones – have the opportunity to drastically improve the quality of life for billions of people. That is why we love what we do: enabling our customers to develop their technology safely using the Parallel Domain data generation platform. Our platform revolutionizes the way our customers generate sensor data for AI development. We're looking for people like you to join us in pushing the boundaries of artificial intelligence and synthetic data.

Parallel Domain envisions a future where every life on the planet is improved by the transition to safer and more equitable AI. To enable that future, we are on a mission to accelerate the development of machine perception with synthetic data.
We don't define ourselves by the boxes we check, we define ourselves by how we can develop and face challenges that elevate our true potential. We expect you to apply to an opportunity that aligns with your skills, professional goals and core values. Due to the high number of applicants, only those selected to move forward with an interview will be contacted.
What You'll Do:
You’ll be part of the ML research team tasked with establishing best practises on creating and using synthetic data for perception
You’ll develop perception algorithms, data pipelines, introspection tools, domain gap measures and domain adaptation approaches
You’ll summarize your findings to help guide our team as well as our customers
You’ll sync with your team on a daily basis to discuss progress, ideas and problems
You’ll work with veterans from the gaming, movie and automotive industry
What You'll Own:
Creating specific datasets for your experiments
Adapting/implementing cutting-edge models and data pipelines
Maintaining and optimizing our code base to enable fast experimentation
Writing tools to inspect and measure the impact of synthetic data on training
Summarizing and sharing your findings
Supporting our customers
Staying up to date with the latest research on synthetic data
About You:
You are eager to learn and to add value to the team
You are a team-player and understand the importance of clear communication
You thrive in ambiguous environments
You are not afraid to approach new challenges
What You Bring:
Master’s or PhD in computer science or a related field
Well-versed with developing machine learning models for computer vision tasks in either an industry or research environment
Extensive experience in python
Ability to write clean/maintainable code
Working knowledge of Pytorch or Tensorflow
You are fluent in english
Bonus Points:
Experience with developing, deploying and improving perception stacks on AVs
Experience with domain adaptation approaches or custom domain gap measures
Experience at a fast-growing, young company
Experience with workflow management systems such as Argo, Kubeflow, Airflow, Ray.io
Remote Information: This opportunity is open to candidates based out of the West Coast in the United States or Vancouver, Canada.

Why join Parallel Domain?
We are assembling a team of talented visionaries crafting a new technology that will change the world. You will be able to learn, build, and scale in a collaborative, creative culture that values every team member.
Parallel Domain celebrates diversity and is committed to creating a safe and inclusive environment for all our people. We are committed to providing employees with an environment free of discrimination, bullying and harassment. All employment decisions at Parallel Domain are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications. We will maintain our commitment to and support of equal employment opportunity for all individuals without regard to race, national/ethnic origin, colour, religion, age, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, marital status, family status, genetic characteristics or physical/mental disability. Our commitment extends to any other protected classes which may exist under applicable law.
We offer:Flexibility to work from our office in Yaletown, Vancouver or your home officeCompetitive compensationEmployer-paid supplemental medical, mental health, dental, and vision benefitsPaid vacation and sick time, winter shutdown, and 11 stat holidays each yearPaid parental leaveNew hire equipment + accessories budget to optimize your setup$2,000 CAD annual learning and development allowance
Estudios previos: master’s or phd in computer science or a related field

Descripción:
Location

At GoDaddy the future of work looks different for each team. Some teams work in the office full-time, others have a hybrid arrangement (they work remotely some days and in the office some days) and some work entirely remotely.

This position may be a hybrid or fully remote position, as decided by your manager. If designated as hybrid, you’ll divide your time between working remotely from your home and an office location, so you should live within commuting distance. If designated as remote, you’ll be working remotely from your home and may occasionally visit a GoDaddy office to meet with your team for events or off-sites. Your hiring manager can share more about this role’s hybrid or remote designation.

This position is not eligible to be performed in Alaska, Mississippi, North Dakota, or the Virgin Islands.

Hybrid-or-Remote: This position may be a hybrid or fully remote position, as decided by your manager. If designated as hybrid, you’ll divide your time between working remotely from your home and an office location, so you should live within commuting distance. If designated as remote, you’ll be working remotely from your home and may occasionally visit a GoDaddy office to meet with your team for designation.

Join Our Team

Our team is a part of the Worldwide Engineering organization within GoDaddy, and we are looking to hire a Senior Machine Learning Scientist/Applied Researcher experienced with NLP/NLU to join our ML/AR team. Our goal is to build and grow a community of ML scientists and engineers to learn, share, and grow. We are committed to understanding all major business units, and we thrive on empowering business results by leveraging state-of-the-art ML algorithms.

This core Machine Learning/Applied Research team utilizes large-scale data to power various business areas, and a primary goal is to enhance the effectiveness of our team of customer care and sales partners with ML solutions like the self-service chatbot, a customer-centered case management system, and a configurable dynamic routing system to connect our customers with the team member who can answer their questions.

Your contributions will affect millions of customers and have a direct impact on our business results. Our team's challenges include deriving value from sparse data, understanding large scale shopping data to extract and retrieve information, and developing best practices to create the best customer experience and highest customer engagement. GoDaddy has deep and rich data sets, many still untapped, and your real passion for the cutting-edge machine learning algorithms has the power to unlock tangible business growth.

What you will get to do…

You can articulate and understand a business problem, identify challenges, formulate the ML/NLP problem and provide/prototype solutions
You will provide technical leadership, identify, and understand key business challenges and opportunities, and develop end-to-end software solutions using ML/NLP.
You will collaborate extensively with internal partners, program & product management, and engineering teams to ensure that solution meets business needs, emits valid inferences, and is functionally feasible
You will collect and process large volumes of data and build new and improved techniques and/or solutions for data collection, management, and usage
You will communicate results in a comprehensible manner to all levels of the company (field teams up to Senior Management)
You will brainstorm and share knowledge with other team members

Your experience should include…

Puesto laboral: Lead Software Engineer - Enterprise Data & Analytics
Descripción:
At Franklin Templeton, everything we do is focused on one thing – delivering better client outcomes. We do that by partnering closely with our clients, assessing their strategic needs, and identifying the solution or solutions that can meet the challenge. Over 12,000 employees working in 34 countries around the world are dedicated to servicing investment solutions for our clients in more than 160 countries. For more than 70 years our success has been a direct result of the talent, skills and persistence of our people, and we are looking for qualified candidates to join our team.
What is the Enterprise Data & Analytics group responsible for?
The Enterprise Data & Analytics group’s mission is to build and maintain FT’s most efficient, quality imbibed and scalable Data and Analytics Ecosystem. We drive Innovation with purpose and value maintaining integrity in everything we do with respect and appreciation. Functional business units we support are, India Sales Reporting, Global Product Strategy and Global Marketing.
What is the Lead Software Engineer responsible for?
Lead Software Engineer Provides expertise and experience in application development and production support activities to support business needs. Refactors the codebase of applications and reviews source code of peers. Resolves and identifies root cause for unique production issues. Lead Software Engineer provides expertise, experience, and technical leadership for application design/development and production support activities to support business needs. Leads the definition of software design, development, and integration, and production support of highly complex issues. Mentors and develops more junior engineers.
What are the ongoing responsibilities of a Lead Software Engineer?
Work on a Proof of Concept to streamline the technology process for loading vendor data feeds. Analyze various batch processing frameworks and design a system that is extensible, high-performance, scalable and flexible enough to accommodate future requirements.
Apply significant knowledge of Investment Management processes, financial industry trends and developments, Emerging technologies, ETL and Business Intelligence tools to improve service to our Business Partners.
Resolve production application issues. Anticipate long-term support issues and plan for corrective actions. Perform root cause analysis to identify permanent resolutions to software or business process issues.
Provides technical direction for the design, development, and systems integration utilizing various technologies and translate application storyboards and uses cases into functional application.
Responsible for building out custom connectors to Salesforce & Business Objects utilizing the Java SDK Framework.
Participate in Architecture groups and develop technical architecture of systems that support business groups.
Help drive code quality, organization, and automation.
Improve company’s technical awareness, depth and use of technology across the business. Recognize system deficiencies and suggest alternative technical solutions. Provide technical oversight to Development, Quality Assurance and Support Teams.
Utilizing technical knowledge in data analysis tools and techniques to drive project delivery and work with senior management/business users to determine timelines and develop cost-effective budgets and resource plans.
Required qualifications, skills & experience
Bachelor's degree (Preferred Master’s degree) in Computer Applications, Computer Information Systems, Computer Science or a related field
7 plus years of experience as a Software Engineer with progressive responsibility utilizing the following:
Object Oriented Design Principles, Investment Management processes, Emerging technologies, and Business Intelligence tools
ETL tool Informatica Power Center 9.x+, Informatica Cloud
Oracle (12c+), Oracle performance tuning, Oracle single / composite partitioning, PL/SQL, and data modeling, developing and optimizing backend code
Data Warehouse concepts including Dimensional Modeling, Star schema and Reporting Hierarchies
Unix, Perl and Shell scripting
Business Analytics tool including Tableau, Python, Qlikview
Application design, development and deployment experience in a Linux server environment
Business Objects 4.x and Message Oriented Middleware to work with business users to comprehend and implement large systems supporting financial services industry
Design and development timelines for application components
7 plus years of hands-on experience with:
Project development including analysis and design phases of projects and project management framework and methodology
Working closely with Architecture groups (Internal and/or external) to develop and enhance the technical architecture of the systems that are currently deployed
Design and development timelines for application components
Structured programming principles, system analysis techniques, system design, industry standard testing principles, system implementation, user training and follow-up
Project Management experience working on a team utilizing Agile methodology and working knowledge of SDLC processes
Strong interpersonal and communication skills
Ability to communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing
Company operating name: Franklin Templeton Investments Corp. (FTIC)
Business address: 200 King Street W suite 1500, Toronto, ON M5H 3T4
Employment Type: Regular, Full Time
Language of work: English
Wage: $98,000 to $140,000
Location(s) of work (local area, city or town): Toronto, Ontario
Contact information: Sarah Hammoud | Email: Sarah.hammoud@franklintempleton.com | Phone number: +1 416-957-6115
#LI-DNI
What makes Franklin Templeton unique?

In addition to the dynamic and professional environment at Franklin Templeton, we strive to ensure that our employees have access to a competitive and valuable set of Total Rewards—the mix of both monetary and non-monetary rewards provided to you in recognition for your time, talents, efforts, and results.
Highlights of our benefits include:
Flexible medical, dental and vision insurance
Corporate Pension Plan
Employee Stock Investment Program
Purchase company funds with no sales charge
Competitive vacation package that includes three annual personal days
Company paid short-term and long-term Disability Insurance

Franklin Templeton Investments Corp. is committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. If you require accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.
We believe that being a good corporate citizen is good business. To us, corporate citizenship means being accountable, serving our clients, being an employer of choice, managing our environmental impact, and supporting our communities. An emphasis on corporate citizenship is embedded in our culture and values, and is an important element of how we achieve success.
We are also committed to your learning and development with resources focused around Experience, Exposure, and Education, to help you achieve your professional development goals. Take some time to, meet some of our people, and see what it means to say, "I AM Franklin Templeton”.
Franklin Templeton is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive environment. We are passionate about solving complex problems in data, AI, engineering, design, and product, so our customers don’t have to. as long as they get their work done, get the time approved and get things covered while they're awayStock option grantsA generous home office allowanceCareer development opportunities, and a solid business model - Descripción:
Staff - Non Union
Job Category
M&P - AAPS
Job Profile
AAPS Salaried - Information Systems and Technology, Level A
Job Title
Neuroimaging Data Scientist/Programmer Junior
Department
McKeown Laboratory Pacific Parkinson's Research Centre Division of Neurology | Department of Medicine | Faculty of Medicine
Compensation Range
$4,688.67 - $6,754.00 CAD Monthly
Posting End Date
September 20, 2022
Note: Applications will be accepted until 11:59 PM on the day prior to the Posting End Date above.
Job End Date
Sep 30, 2023
This position is located within a health-care facility, therefore, the successful candidate will be required to provide verification of full vaccination against Covid-19 provided prior to the start date, as required by a provincial health mandate.
Job Summary
Pacific Parkinson’s Research Centre at UBC is seeking a data scientist/programmer. This position is an excellent fit for graduating seniors (or recent graduates) with interest in the field of neuroscience and neuroimaging. We conduct projects associating MRI imaging data (structural, functional, diffusion) with behavioral data in patients with Parkinson’s disease and evaluate how non-invasive brain stimulation interventions change symptom-relevant brain circuits.
A qualified candidate will assist and work closely with the PI and senior-level researchers to set up experiments and analysis pipelines for various neuroimaging, behaviour, and clinical data.
Organizational Status
The data scientist/programmer will report to the Research Manager and Principal Investigator of the study, and will work closely with graduate students, fellows and research staff from different departments on campus.

Work Performed
Developing codes (bash shell scripting, Python, MATLAB, R) to run experiments and preprocess MRI and behavioral data
Conducting data-driven and theory-driven analyses using combinations of supervised and unsupervised learning approaches
Managing project databases
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned
Consequence of Error/Judgement
Errors made could influence the ability of the PI to meet critical deadlines, as well as compromise the results of research projects and affect funding applications, thereby impacting the credibility of the Investigator. Poor decisions may be damaging to the reputation of and cause financial loss to the Principal Investigator, The Centre, the Research Institute and the University.

Supervision Received
The data scientist/programmer will work closely with researchers, graduate students and clinical fellows. Direct supervision will be provided by the Research Manager and Principal investigator of the study.

Supervision Given
None

Minimum Qualifications
Undergraduate degree in a relevant discipline. Minimum of one year of related experience, or the equivalent combination of education and experience.

Preferred Qualifications
Experience with neuroimaging tools (FSL, Freesurfer, AFNI, SPM, ANTs) and neuroimaging data preprocessing
Excellent programming knowledge (Python, MATLAB, R, and linux/bash)
A deep understanding of a variety of statistical concepts, machine learning approaches, clustering and classification techniques, and optimization algorithms.
Experience with popular machine learning frameworks and libraries (xgboost/lightGBM, Keras, Tensorflow, Pytorch, pandas, numpy, etc).
Experience with version control using Git and Code Collaboration practices.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and attention to details are desirable
Knowledge in basics of digital image processing is a plus
Estudios previos: undergraduate degree in a relevant discipline
Habilidades blandas: strong analytical and problem-solving skills and attention to details

Descripción: JUNIOR SOFTWARE DEVELOPER – TWO POSITIONSAre you looking to help drive the design and development of software solutions that can truly change the world? Seriously. Are you passionate about our environment and sustainability? Can you play nice with humans and machines?Join our diverse development team on our drive the modernization of fisheries data collection and analysis for our customer-base worldwide. This work includes the implementation of AI and Machine Learning algorithms for data and video analysis, remote fleet-monitoring software, video analysis applications and mobile data collection apps. These advancements will help maintain Archipelago’s role as the global leader in fisheries Electronic Monitoring hardware and software, supporting sustainable fishing practices worldwide.WHAT ARE WE ALL ABOUT?Archipelago has been around for over 40 years and is at the forefront of electronic monitoring solutions for fisheries around the world. We create and deploy remote monitoring technology for commercial fishing vessels, and dockside monitors to collect data and report back to our clients. This data helps manage global fisheries and ensure sustainability for generations to come. Our head office sits right on the water in Victoria (Esquimalt), British Columbia and we have offices in Alaska, Oregon, Australia, Norway and in port cities up and down the British Columbia coast.Our electronic monitoring technology has been deployed on over 700 fishing vessels around the world and we work with government agencies like DFO, NOAA and AFMA (Australia) and MPI (New Zealand). We support organizations like The Nature Conservancy (TNC) and the Environmental Defense Fund (EDF) in their efforts to create more sustainable fisheries around the world.WHAT DO WE OFFER? 1 temporary full-time position for 8 months intended specifically for students currently enrolled in a computer science, data science, business technology management or related co-op or equivalent post-secondary work experience degree program, commencing in January 2023
The Financial and Corporate Services Department’s role is to lead the organization in becoming a modern municipal corporation with a special focus on competency, leadership and culture. We are currently looking to add a Junior Data Scientist Work Experience Student to the Data Science and Research team.

Experience with programming languages and relational databases such as SQL

Descripción:
CIVIL ASSETS RELIABILITY ANALYTICS ENGINEER

Winnipeg, MB

Manitoba Hydro is consistently recognized as one of Manitoba's Top Employers!

Great Benefits
Competitive salary and benefits package.Defined-benefit pension plan.Nine-day work cycle which normally results in every other Monday off, providing for a balanced approach to work, family life

and community.
Flex-time and partially remote work schedule, depending on nature of work, operational requirements and work location.

Manitoba Hydro is a leader among energy companies in North America, recognized for providing highly reliable service and
exceptional customer satisfaction. Join our team of Manitoba's best as we continue to build a company that supports innovation,
commitment and customer service.

We are seeking a Civil Assets Reliability Analytics Engineer to join our Asset Lifecycle Management Department. You will
be responsible for evidence-based reliability analysis of lifecycle processes for corporate civil and linear assets, and to ensure these
assets lifecycle policies are developed with optimal lifecycle management principles, ensuring cost/performance/risk profiles are
optimized across the asset(s) lifecycle(s).

Responsibilities:
Responsible for evidence-based analysis, to develop the long-term plan for assessment and management of the reliability of
civil and linear assets. Develop and maintain a long-term plan, based on key stakeholder input, which details the ultimate
requirements for the Corporation's civil and linear assets assessment and lifecycle management, the current gaps and action
plans to address the gaps.
Ensure Asset Management asset decisions are quantitative, and evidence based by creating and maintaining processes and
systems for asset centric data collection and reliability analysis of cost performance and risk.
Develop reports for evaluating the repair, refurbish, replace decisions.Documenting, prioritizing, planning, delivering and evaluating civil plant operations, and minimize the risk and impact of failure

in civil assets and processes.
Identify and report on potential failures within a process or system or civil assets. Seek, recommend and develop innovative

concepts applicable to the civil and linear assets to optimize lifecycle decision making.

Lead development and documentation of processes involved and perform detailed reliability analysis of the corporation's civil

and linear assets to develop optimal asset strategies, balancing cost performance and risk.
Perform Failure mode and effects analysis (FMEA), Reliability hazard analysis, and root cause analysis on civil and linear

assets.
Assess the risks of failure of all civil and linear assets considering asset condition assessments, indexing, supporting

development and maintenance degradation and probability of failure curves; working closely with Asset Information & Risk
Management Department Risk assessment methodology for civil and linear assets.
Make recommendations based on analysis and civil engineering knowledge for Preventative and Planned Maintenance
Optimization.
Provide analysis and assist to make recommendations with regards to Lifecycle Value optimization of civil assets, input into
development of business processes and tools and to whole lifecycle cost models of civil and linear assets.
Determine maintenance or capital investment based on functional analysis of civil assets, by using lifecycle value
identification.
Act as an SME to develop capital project alternatives for civil assets within the Corporate Value Framework, working with the
Civil Asset Advisor.
Build and maintain relations with design, operations, maintenance, project management, resource planning, plant, finance,
property, and other groups within and outside of the division for the purposes of information sharing and team alignment.
Collaborate with other utilities and external organizations to establish reliability benchmarks for civil and linear assets to

MANITOBA HYDRO IS COMMITTED TO DIVERSITY AND EMPLOYMENT EQUITY
 Reference Code: CO56601739-01

optimize lifecycle delivery.
Provide civil engineering expertise and reliability engineering services to other parts of Manitoba Hydro related to civil and

linear assets, emerging trends and technologies, and the application of reliability analysis, including directing or conducting
meetings, seminars or presentation and training.

Qualifications:
Graduate in a related Engineering discipline from a university of recognized standing with a minimum of seven years of related
experience having obtained three years of this experience in design, construction, maintenance or project management of civil
assets.
Professional member in good standing with Engineers Geoscientists Manitoba.
Advanced knowledge of Civil & Linear type assets including the design, operation, reliability, compliance requirements,
maintenance practices, and modes of failure.
Basic knowledge of other asset types including but not limited to Mechanical, Electrical, Gas type assets.Knowledge of RCM theory, root cause analysis work management cycleKnowledge of Asset Management best practices.Advanced knowledge in maintenance applications and condition assessment processes related to asset management.Must have a good working knowledge of Safety and Environmental Regulations.Must have proven ability to co-ordinate the activities of others providing engineering services as required. Must be able to

work effectively with various levels in the organization and externally including consultants, contractors and suppliers.
Must have good inter-disciplinary organizational skills, ability to train others, make presentations and delegate authority.Must have a demonstrated ability to analyze and prepare engineering reports and standards, and to develop processes.Possess practical experience and working knowledge of CMMS, SAP, GIS applications, and Microsoft Office.May be required to visit various stations across the province.Required to travel by all modes of transportation i.e. air, land and water.
Possess and maintain a valid Province of Manitoba driver's licence.

NOTE: May be required to work at other locations within the province, and where transportation between these sites may
be by small aircraft.

Salary Range

Starting salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience. The range for the classification is $47.09 -$64.51 Hourly,
$90,229.10-$123,616.48 Annually.

Apply Now!

Visit www.hydro.mb.ca/careers to learn more about this position and to apply online. The deadline for applications is SEPTEMBER
26, 2022.
